lines: Go for Duck.

speaker: Voice
lines: In three minutes, your friend Leo Tarkesian is going to die. He will be crushed to death, as will the two customers currently shopping in his store. You might want to do something about that.

speaker: [Theme music (The Adventure Zone
lines: Amnesty Theme by Griffin McElroy) plays]

speaker: Griffin
lines: The voice on the other end of the phone hangs up, Duck. And a stiff breeze blows down Kepler's main drag sending snow swirling around nearby buildings— the Pizza Hut, Dave's Dehumidifier Depot, and Leo's General Store, where he and his customers will apparently be crushed to death in a little under three minutes. What do you do?

lines: Okay, so on a Read a Bad Situation you hold three, actually. You can ask what's my best way in, what's my best way out, are there any dangers we haven't noticed, what's the biggest threat, what's most vulnerable to me, and what's the best way to protect the victims.

lines: Okay. You achieve that. And it is— it is clumsy, It does not look very smooth. It does not look very cool. And she just sees this sort of column of smoke do a curly-Q in the air, and I think by the time— when you actually make contact with the sign, I think you flipped around so that the jetpack itself catches the brunt of the damage because you get the sense if your skull had been the recipient of it you would have just— you would die. You would have been dead very very quickly.

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah. [crosstalk]

speaker: Travis
lines: But instead you died slowly.

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah instead it's kind of a slow death kind of thing.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Well, instead, Duck, from you— you're looking up from your position, and you see just sparks shoot into the air— shoot through the air. And Ned, you just— you are instantly unconscious. You are instantly unconscious from this huge amount of blunt force trauma you experience. Your body sails 20 feet past the sign and rolls to a stop sort of smoking in the snow. And the Flymaster, I think it keeps on going. I think it comes unlatched from you, and it skitters to a stop, like, 50 feet past you. It sort of dances across the snow, sort of flying past your unconscious form. And you take four harm.

speaker: Travis
lines: I'm sure we'll find that again later.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Ned, I need you to mark Unstable. On your harm tracker.

speaker: Clint
lines: Oooooo.

speaker: Griffin
lines: If you do not get medical attention now, you are... going to die.

speaker: Clint
lines: Alright. Unstable. And then mark four harm?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yes. With that, though, the sign— it teeters on the edge of the building and sort of slides off. You blast into this motherfucker so hard that you completely push it just... off. Off the building. And it slides harmlessly off the back. And with that, Duck you— Leo is— Leo's kind of scr— you know, he was screaming for a second as his store was destroyed, and he's calmed down, and he says,

speaker: Leo
lines: Okay, uh, next time I will listen up. [fumbling] Can we— you got— we gotta get out of here. I-I-I— I don't want— I— we— we gotta get Denny from the bathroom. He was— he was in the bathroom. We gotta get him. We gotta get—

speaker: Duck
lines: Calm down, alright? Listen. I got a plus two cool. So we're— I'm gonna get you through this. Alright? You get out, I'll get Denny off the can... and— and then we'll— I don't know, we'll call the... the sheriff down here and start the insurance stuff. But get out now. I'll go get Denny. Don't worry.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You can already hear sirens in the distance. I think that this is, you know, happening on the main drag, and folks definitely saw a Pizza Hut sign, you know, teeter and fall into a business. I think that you definitely hear sirens on the way. I also don't think, like— I think the danger has passed. The sign is now off the building. It's not going to fall in and collapse, and I think Denny and Leo and you are able to get out of the store without any danger, and you see Aubrey on the ground by the sign where it fell. And I don't know if you see Ned.

speaker: Duck
lines: Aubrey! Hey! Hey! Aubrey!

speaker: Justin
lines: I rush over to her first, I think. She's right there.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Sure.

speaker: Duck
lines: Aubrey, did— did you knock over the sign? Aubrey?

speaker: Aubrey
lines: [quietly, to herself] I killed Duck...

speaker: Duck
lines: No— What?

speaker: Aubrey
lines: [quietly] killed Duck.

speaker: Duck
lines: Aaahh no. This is a ghost thing, isn't it? Hey Leo! Can you see me?

speaker: Leo
lines: [confused] Yeah I can see you. You— you look a little shaken up, and you got some soup on you—

speaker: Duck
lines: Alright nevermind that's fine. Hey, Aubrey, I'm not dead. Look.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: [quietly] Not again, no. No.

speaker: Duck
lines: No no no, Aubrey, look look look. I'm not dead.

speaker: Justin
lines: God, hold on. Duck probably travels with a first aid kit of some sort, right? Like, doesn't that— [crosstalk] does that track for you?

speaker: Travis
lines: [crosstalk] Like a cool, like, fanny pack.

speaker: Justin
lines: Like, as a ranger? It seems like he would have, like, some [crosstalk] bare necessities... first aid stuff

speaker: Griffin
lines: [crosstalk] Yeah, in his pack, I think he definitely has— Yeah, I mean this is not your primary job, but I think if you're on the trail doing your sort of forest tending and you come across somebody who's injured themselves, you definitely want to be prepared. So yeah, I think in your sort of all day carry you've got some supplies for first aid.

speaker: Justin
lines: Alright. I'll grab that up and get out the space blanket that I keep in there.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Justin
lines: And pull out— 'cause I can recognize— I think I probably recognize shock.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright. Yeah. You get that all wrapped around Aubrey, and I think at this point an ambulance from St. Francis has pulled up, as have a couple of squad cars from the sheriff's station. You see Sheriff Zeke and Deputy Dewey step out of those. And immediately some EMTs rush out of the ambulance and towards the building, looking for anybody who has gotten injured. And they do a— quickly poke their head inside and they kind of get waved off by the sheriff, who doesn't want them to, you know... doesn't want the building to collapse on them. And one of the EMTs points off in the distance, and Duck, you see two EMTs rush over with their supplies and start tending to Ned, who you now see face down in the snow.

speaker: Justin
lines: Alright, I would rush over there next.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright. He looks very bad. Whatever coat he was wearing now just has a big burn mark on the back of it. And you don’t see any- it’s not gruesome; it’s not like there’s bones jutting out of Ned, but he looks bad. The EMTs are working on him, and one of them says

speaker: EMT
lines: Do you know what happened to him?

speaker: Duck
lines: Um… oh boy… do you want the truth or a more convincing lie? Um, nah so, okay, right… so the Pizza Hut sign started to fall, ‘cause of the weather, and he ran up there on… a fire escape… and tried to push it? …With a bat? Damn it. Nah, he just pushed it, and it fell, and then he fell ‘cause he got shocked. I bet… I didn’t see. Ah, shit! Alright, hey guys, rewind. I was inside, I didn’t see anything! I don’t know… this man. I do know this man. Fuck!

speaker: Duck
lines: Alright, so this man’s name is Ned, and he’s a friend of mine, and I don’t know what the hell happened to him, but you know this guy. He’s always getting into something. I don’t know, I was in the building, I almost got killed by a Pizza Hut sign. I might be in shock!

speaker: Travis
lines: [laughing] This is where we find out that Duck got his nickname because one time, he tried to explain something to someone, and it just kept autocorrecting “fuck” over and over again!

speaker: Griffin
lines: It’s been a few hours since the accident. It was a few very stressful hours, maybe especially for you, Duck, because you were the only one fully cognizant during all of this… you rode in the ambulance with Aubrey and Ned to the hospital. Leo came, too, he just felt bad about abandoning you all after you went to such great lengths to help try and save his store and the people inside of it. And it’s been a few hours, you’re in a recovery room with Aubrey—and I think, Aubrey, at this point, you have recovered from the state that you were in, right in the immediate aftermath of the sign falling over—and Ned is there, also. He is in bed, and he’s hooked up to machines and an IV, and… I think you’re in and out, Ned. I think you’re doing better; they’ve stabilized you, and go ahead and remove 1 Harm, to get yourself back up to 3 Harm.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: That is for Ned, not for Duck.

speaker: Justin
lines: Just listening.

speaker: Justin
lines: ...Active listener.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You all are in the room together, Leo is waiting out in the hallway, and Mama showed up a few minutes ago after she heard what happened. And that is the scene, you—Duck—and Aubrey and Mama are debriefing about what just happened. And Mama’s kind of got her hand on Ned’s knee, and just pats it a couple of times, making sure he knows, like, “hang in there, bud”, and she says

speaker: Mama
lines: Alright, so, walk me through all this again. You all saw some sort of hooded, hooved figure out in the snow, whipped up a snowstorm, y’all couldn’t see, car stalled out, and then… you got a heads-up that the Pizza Hut sign was about to fall on Leo’s general store.

speaker: Duck
lines: Yeah, that’s correct.

speaker: Mama
lines: And they knew it was you who was gonna answer the phone.

speaker: Duck
lines: Right.

speaker: Mama
lines: What did they sound like? Did you get any idea of who it might’ve been? Was it somebody you knew, was is a voice you recognized?

speaker: Duck
lines: [sarcastic] Uh… it was a few weeks ago, so I’m havin’ trouble remembering if I recognized the voice. Let me think about it, hold on.

speaker: Justin
lines: And I pray.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [laughing] Why?

speaker: Justin
lines: [laughing] I pray to Griffin to remind me if I recognized the voice or not.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You didn’t. You definitely didn’t.

speaker: Duck
lines: Nah, Mama, I didn’t recognize the voice at all.

speaker: Mama
lines: Well shit, man, I dunno. I guess we can wait and see if they reach out again. Did it seem like they were friend or foe? I mean, obviously, they gave you a heads-up, but who’s to say they weren’t the ones—

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Mama, there was magic.

speaker: Mama
lines: There was magic?

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Yeah, the wind… the wind was not normal.

speaker: Duck
lines: Yeah, something strange was goin’ on.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: It felt like a lot of stuff, like… it felt like we were jinxed.

speaker: Duck
lines: I got a thought it was a call into a payphone, right? So, maybe we could, like… track it? Like, find out who’s called that payphone or somethin’.

speaker: Mama
lines: I mean, if nobody else’s called it or used that payphone since, we could Star 69 it and see—

speaker: Duck
lines: Hell yeah! One that’s hysterical; secondly, that’s a great idea!

speaker: Aubrey
lines: I mean, it’s one of two things either it’s the person who knew the sign was gonna fall down ‘cause they made it happen, or it’s a person who knew somethin’ was gonna happen who might be able to help us in the future.

speaker: Mama
lines: Alright, well, we gotta chase any clue we can get! We gotta get to that payphone before someone else can use it or recieve a call.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And Jake stands up from the corner of the room, and he says

speaker: Jake
lines: Yeah, this is somethin’ Jake can do.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And he pulls out his board and just goes running out of the room.

speaker: Duck
lines: Now, Jake, wait! Can you remember the number?

speaker: Jake
lines: Yeah, it’s the star-shaped button and then the funny sex joke.

speaker: Duck
lines: You got it, Jake! I’m real proud of you, go get ‘em, partner!

speaker: Griffin
lines: He gives you a big thumbs-up and a finger gun, and he runs out of the room.

speaker: Duck
lines: [yelling] Not 420, Jake!

speaker: Duck
lines: … God damn it, he’s gonna hit—

speaker: Clint
lines: [yelling] You’re gonna want to do 420!

speaker: Duck
lines: [yelling] You’re gonna wanna do 420, Jake!

speaker: Travis
lines: I would say, at this point, Aubrey looks over and, like, Ned’s eyes are closed, and she says

speaker: Aubrey
lines: [sullenly] Hey, Duck, could you go get me a coffee from the vending machine at the end of the room? I don’t care if it’s gross vending machine coffee, I would love it.

speaker: Duck
lines: Yeah. Do you want any cream?

speaker: Aubrey
lines: No.

speaker: Duck
lines: Any sugars?

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Nope. Just black, please.

speaker: Duck
lines: What if it has, like, a mocha? Do you want a mocha kind of thing?

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Duck, just black coffee, please.

speaker: Duck
lines: Do you want a small or a medium or a large? You have any size—?

speaker: Griffin
lines: There’s tons of options.

speaker: Clint
lines: Grande? You could get a grande?

speaker: Justin
lines: Ned, you’re asleep, hold on…

speaker: Duck
lines: [sarcastic, overdramatic] Oh, thank god! Aw, Ned’s okay, y’all! He’s talkin’ normal and he’s all fine! He sounds like Clint McElroy, beloved DJ!

speaker: Aubrey
lines: [sarcastic] Aw, he’s back down.

speaker: Duck
lines: [sarcastic] He’s back down.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: The biggest they got, Duck. Just the biggest, cheapest, blackest coffee they got.

speaker: Mama
lines: Make that two, Duck, if you don’t mind.

speaker: Duck
lines: Okay, Mama, do you want cream or anything...?

speaker: Mama
lines: Nah, I’m good. Just literally the same exact order. Why don’t you git, I think Aubrey’s trying to have a delicate conversation.

speaker: Duck
lines: Same size, or…?

speaker: Mama
lines: It’s gonna be a delicate conversation, Duck, why don’t you git.

speaker: Duck
lines: I just wanna make sure you’re gettin’ taken care of, they got those li’l [unintelligible]

speaker: Griffin
lines: Mama walks and opens the door up.

speaker: Duck
lines: Aw, I get it. [Mama Yeah, go git.] Alright, sorry about that—yeah, yeah, I’ll be… yeah. Damn it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Duck is out of the room, and now it is just an unconscious Ned and Mama and you, Aubrey.

speaker: Justin
lines: Should I take my headphones off?

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, ‘cause we got stuff.

speaker: Travis
lines: You can know this shit.

speaker: Justin
lines: [defensive] I dunno, it’s kinda fun!

speaker: Travis
lines: Because I want you, the player, to know so we can get back to it and work it back into the story—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Travis
lines: Because we’re all writing it and—

speaker: Justin
lines: Got it.

speaker: Clint
lines: But would Ned know? ‘Cause he’s kinda semi-conscious…

speaker: Travis
lines: Maybe he will and you’ll see if that comes up, maybe that’s why you’re in the fucking room, Clinton!

speaker: Griffin
lines: We’re playing this together, it’s all happening in real time! It’s like if we just fuckin’ forgot!

speaker: Travis
lines: Will you just fuckin’ write a story—

speaker: Clint
lines: I’m really into character!

speaker: Travis
lines: Write the fucking story with me! We are New York Times bestselling authors!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright. Mama is here alone with you, Aubrey, she says

speaker: Mama
lines: Aubrey, what’s goin’ on? You seem really shaken up, obviously it was a tough night, but… did somethin’ happen?

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Mama, do you remember when we met at the magic show, and you saw me do magic, and I told you it was the first time?

speaker: Mama
lines: Yeah? You’re talking about actual magic, right?

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Yeah. …I don’t think it was the first time.

speaker: Mama
lines: What do you mean? Did you remember somethin’? What… what other time has there been, Aubrey?

speaker: Aubrey
lines: When I was 18… the night I was leavin’ home… someone broke into our house, two men, I don’t know… I was runnin’ to see what the sound was and I tripped and hit my head on the banister of the stairs. And when I woke up, the house was on fire. …And I think that was… my fault…

speaker: Mama
lines: [sigh] Shit, Aubrey. I mean, do you know that for sure, Aubrey? Or is this just the guilt, maybe?

speaker: Aubrey
lines: The fire started on the second floor, where I was, and they were breakin’ in downstairs, and I… never really… thought about that… before now. It’s like I can… almost remember it.

speaker: Mama
lines: I mean, that might be relevant. If it’s true, Aubrey, then that means that your magical abilities don’t have anything to do with you bein’ in Kepler or close to the gate or close to Sylvain—a lot of our theories about that are shot, but… I’m sorry about your house burnin’ down, that must’ve been hard.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: …My mom died in the fire. Dad got out, but… the part my mom was in collapsed.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I don’t think she knows how to respond to that. She just stands there, mouth open, for a bit and… wraps you back up in that blanket, and… I think she doesn’t know what to do, because she brought you here, and then she disappeared for a couple months, and then she showed back up. And I don’t know what your relationship has been like since then? But I think she takes a beat and then she leans down, and she just wraps the blanket around you and gives you a little kiss on the top of the head. And she says

speaker: Mama
lines: I’mma go see what’s taking Duck so long with that coffee.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Before we do anything else, I have a super super super important question for Ned... and that question is going to determine some stuff based on what the answer is, but, how much of that did Ned... actually hear?

speaker: Clint
lines: I think he heard... I think he heard all of it. I think he's not exactly in a coma—

speaker: Griffin
lines: No.

speaker: Clint
lines: —but I think he's out of it enough that he's— he's not feigning unconsciousness, but I think he heard the whole story.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Then I think Ned has just had a pretty horrible...

speaker: Clint
lines: [chuckling] Extremely horrible.

speaker: Griffin
lines: ...realization.

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Then I think, in this sort of, like, in and out of consciousness state that you're in, you hear all of this, and you are taken back to that night. And I think you just see little bits and pieces of it in this state [underscoring starts]. I think you probably bonked your noggin something fierce when you did your jetpack stunt, and so, it's not coming to you in one sort of linear thread, but you remember pulling up to the house... and you remember doing a quick lap around it to find the best entrance, to check for security. You remember going inside. You remember carefully taking things. You remember getting caught. And you remember the car crash with your partner during your speedy escape, as Aubrey speaks from what seems like miles away and you realize... it was her house that you robbed that night. [underscoring ends]

speaker: Griffin
lines: Hey, Duck. You're out in the hallway, right? You were getting coffee?

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I think you see Leo out there. Leo looks pretty shaken up as you come back with the two cups of joe. He's sitting there and he's kinda got his head in his hands.

speaker: Duck
lines: Uhh... Hey. Leo. How's it going? You alright?

speaker: Griffin
lines: He looks up. He kinda wipes his nose. He says,

speaker: Leo
lines: Nah Duck, I'm not doing good— very good at all, thanks. Thanks for asking. I know— I'm sorry. I'm— I shouldn't yell. I'm sorry that was mean of me. I just... that was my fucking store, Duck, and it's gone now. I mean there's parts of it still standing and maybe there's a few, you know, boxes of cereal that didn't get smushed. But uh... that was my— that was my life, Duck. When I came to Kepler, I moved down here from New York and I didn't— I didn't— I didn't have anything, and... I'd just gotten out of a sort of long-term gig, and then... I didn't have nothing and that was hard for me and I didn't know what my purpose was and I found that store and that was my purpose and it was a good— it was a good purpose, but... uh... fuck, Duck, man. It's just... It just sucks.

speaker: Duck
lines: Yeah. Yeah. There's no arguing about that.

speaker: Leo
lines: I guess I'm still around to maybe rebuild, and I guess that's entirely thanks to you, so... I knew the people were gonna be good neighbors here in Kepler, Duck, but I didn't expect that kinda— that kinda treatment, so I don't know what to say, man. I don't know how I can repay you.

speaker: Duck
lines: Well, you know, it's the least I could do. I'm sorry, you know, about the store... What about... I see people, like— what about Kickstarting. Is that a thing? Can you Kickstart it?

speaker: Leo
lines: Like a motorcycle? What do you— Like—

speaker: Duck
lines: Nah, you like— I think... I don't actually know. I've just seen sometimes when there's a fire or whatever, or like... some people Kickstart it. I don't know how you get in on there or if you just ask, or... or what.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He says,

speaker: Leo
lines: I guess I'll go to the library and see where I can find out. Um... you know what I'm gonna do? I'm gonna get a lawyer, and I don't know nothing about law stuff, but it seems like I might be able to get a little bit of money out of the Pizza Hut, right?

speaker: Duck
lines: Yeah, I mean, Pizza Hut's kinda— hey, do you not have insurance?

speaker: Leo
lines: I do, yeah, I do, but it's gonna take a little bit for that to come through. In the meantime maybe I can get a few free personal pan 'zas out of it.

speaker: Duck
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Leo
lines: And that's what I can do for you. I'll split you some of the 'zas.

speaker: Duck
lines: Yeah. You're being— I'll be honest, Leo, you're being kinda despondent for a guy who maybe just has to wait a little while and get a check to fix up his store, ya know? You're seeming out in the hallway a little bit like... doom and gloom, when really what you got is kind of an unplanned vacation, you know? You'll get up and runnin' again... just let the gears of... uh... State Farm start turning.

speaker: Leo
lines: You got a point there, Duck. It's just... it's been my experience that when you find your calling in this life... it doesn't make any sense to put off doing it. You know what I mean? I'm gonna head out. I'm gonna head back to the shop. I better take stock of what's still standing. But— you... you take care of yourself Duck. I don't know what Kepler'd do without you.

speaker: Duck
lines: Alright. Fair enough.

speaker: Travis
lines: So now you have a bond with Leo Tarkesian.

speaker: Justin
lines: [crosstalk] A life bond. Can't wait to summon him.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [laughing] You get his summon crystal. [Justin laughing]. You throw it to the ground and it shatters.

speaker: Justin
lines: I take it to the fairy godmother and she— [Justin laughing]

speaker: Griffin
lines: Mmhmm. And I think as he walks by, he brushes past Jake, who comes running back in. He's got a lot of snow up on his pants. He's got his board that he's got slung over his back, and he runs up to you Duck, and he says,

speaker: Jake
lines: [out of breath through the entire conversation] Oh God.

speaker: Duck
lines: You okay?

speaker: Jake
lines: Oh my God. Yeah, it's just. I ran really fast and I... I snowboarded— I cross-country snowboarded some of the way. But I got to the payphone.

speaker: Duck
lines: Well, what's the number?

speaker: Jake
lines: I had the phonebook so I ran the number in there.

speaker: Duck
lines: [crosstalk] You— you ran the number in there? What?

speaker: Jake
lines: And I found— Yeah. I went through all the numbers one by one and I found the phone number.

speaker: Travis
lines: Wait, what? No wonder he's tired, that would have taken days!

speaker: Jake
lines: Is that weird? I just went through it really fast.

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh God, he's a Beholder.

speaker: Jake
lines: So I just— oh my God. Can I have— ?

speaker: Griffin
lines: He takes one of the cups of coffee and just, like, slams it.

speaker: Duck
lines: Yes. Go for it man, shit.

speaker: Jake
lines: That hurt my mouth really bad... but... the number that called you. It was from the Eastwood Campground, and uh, RV Park. That was the— I'm gonna fuckin' die, man.

speaker: Duck
lines: The... where?

speaker: Jake
lines: The Eastwood Campground and RV Park. That's what the phone number said.

speaker: Travis
lines: Is that where we first met Pigeon?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Umm... No. Duck, I think you would know this as more of a sort of long term RV park. Not quite like a— like a trailer park, but for folks who maybe want to like walk part of the trail— like, the Appalachian Trail— and leave their Winnebago or what have you in a secure spot. This is sort of more of a long term rental place.

speaker: Justin
lines: Alright.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And as he tells you the source of the telephone call, you hear the phone ring inside of Ned's room.

speaker: Travis
lines: [hesitantly] Aubrey answers it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Yeah— He— Hello?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Aubrey, you hear that voice that you heard earlier this evening on the payphone, and this voice says,

speaker: Voice
lines: Well done! I have to say, as someone who's tried to defy the whims of fate myself a fair number of times, I— I didn't think you'd actually pull it off.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Listen... Um... Hi. Thank you for your help? Who are you?

speaker: Voice
lines: That is a complicated question, Aubrey, one that will make a lot more sense when we meet tomorrow afternoon at my home. Once Ned is back up and on his feet again. My name is Indrid Cold. That was the name I was born with in Sylvain. It's a— it's a nice name… I've always thought. Perhaps a bit on the nose. A bit, you know, supernatural sounding. But there's nothing I can do about that, can I? But I think you're asking a different question.

speaker: [The Adventure Zone
lines: Amnesty Theme by Griffin McElroy plays]

speaker: Voice
lines: I'm known as something different to the folks of this area. It's a nickname I picked up when I was younger and a bit more careless about my public persona. I don't prefer this title, myself, but, well... I'm the Mothman! See you tomorrow!
